steps.content: Her birth name is Beyonc√© Giselle Knowles, but she added ‚ÄúCarter‚Äù to her name when she married Jay-Z (whose real name is Shawn Carter) in 2008. The mononymous singer was born Beyonc√© Giselle Knowles on September 4, 1981, at the Park Plaza Hospital in Houston, Texas‚Äîmaking her 43 years old as of January 2025. As of 2025, Beyonc√© and her husband Jay-Z live primarily in two mansions in California: one in Malibu and one in Bel Air. [5] X Research source While the Carters spend most of their time in California, they also own properties in other places (including New York City).

Beyonc√© met Jay-Z when she was 18 and her now-husband was 30. The pair claim that they were just friends for a year and a half before they began dating. [6] X Research source A lot of speculation about the couple‚Äôs relationship occurred in 2016 when Beyonc√© released her album, Lemonade . The album‚Äôs themes touched on infidelity within a marriage and the journey to forgiveness. In a November 2017 interview, Jay-Z admitted that he did cheat on Beyonc√©, but the pair was able to repair their relationship. He touched on the topic again in 2018, commenting in a CNN interview that ‚Äúthe best apology is changed behavior‚Äù and ‚Äúthe other side is beautiful‚Äîat least for us.‚Äù As for who Jay-Z cheated on Beyonc√© with, that person has never come forward or been confirmed. Rumors have swirled about individuals like Rita Ora and Rachel Roy, but there‚Äôs been absolutely no evidence to confirm these accusations. [7] X Research source

[11] X Research source Beyonc√© keeps her (many) Grammys in her office. Her office is decorated like a boutique hotel with plush sectionals, hardwood floors, and a huge contemporary chandelier. Beyonc√© won the coveted award for her first official country album, COWBOY CARTER , which boasts a celebration and recognition of the oft-ignored Black roots of country music. In 2013, Beyonc√© surprise-released a self-titled album without any promotion or marketing leading up to the drop. While Beyonc√© wasn‚Äôt the first artist to release a surprise album, the groundbreaking nature of her drop is widely considered to have forever changed the way music is released. [19] X Research source For example, Harvard Business School did a case study on the album‚Äôs release and success, maintaining that Beyonc√©‚Äôs lack of reliance on a studio or any other entity for the drop made it an industry-changing event. [20] X Research source Other surprise albums include In Rainbows by Radiohead (2007), Channel ORANGE by Frank Ocean (2012), The Next Day by David Bowie (2013), and folklore by Taylor Swift (2020).
